newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: SKorea Shindongbang asks to halt Midopa bond issue.
newsitem.headline: SKorea Shindongbang asks to halt Midopa bond issue.

text.p: Shindongbang Corp of South Korea asked a Seoul court to prevent Midopa Department Store Co from issuing equity-linked bonds, a company statement said on Wednesday.

The country's largest edible oil company told the Korea Stock Exchange it filed the application with a Seoul court to prohibit the retailer from issuing convertible bonds or bonds with warrants to a third party.
Shindongbang earlier said it was considering taking over Midopa, which startled the stock market.
Shindongbang with its joint venture Dongbang Peregrine currently hold a 6.74 percent stake in the retailer.
The statement said the company also asked the court to nullify Midopa's issue of 50 billion won worth of bonds with warrants last Friday and the exercising right by underwriters.

Local institutions affiliated with the top three conglomerates bought all of the bonds. They are entitled to exchange bonds for Midopa shares over three years from July. Some analysts said the bond was one of ways for Midopa to defend the takeover bid.
Shindongbang also demanded the court prevent any attempt Midopa from selling Dainong shares, the statement said.
